channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Build a Great Brand: Align What You Think, Do, and Say
item.description: Are you aware of Content marketing? I certainly wasn't before. Read this article to see how LinkedIn used it to the full extent.

item.title: Help For Mobile App Devs From Text Mining
item.description: If you are mobile app developers then this is a must read for you explaining how to parse customer reviews quickly with a new text-mining method.

item.title: How Becoming An Early Riser Can Change Your Life
item.description: This reminds me of my Dad, who always insisted to be an early riser. I never listened to his advise and even today I never get to see the sunrise. Reading this article brings back some old memories.

item.title: What opportunities are there for Perl in Cloudflareâ€™s serverless environment?
item.description: In this blog, Tom Metro, explains what is Cloudflare and how the Cloudfare's serverless environment opens up the opportunites for Perl. Highly recommended for all Perl lovers.

item.title: Why Facebook's api starts with a for loop
item.description: Antony shares the little secret how Facebook protects the data from JSON hijacking.

item.title: GitHub and AWS
item.description: GitHub works alongside AWS, so your team can collaborate quickly and securely with the tools they already use. With GitHub and AWS, you can integrate existing workflows and save time to focus on whatâ€™s important: your code.

item.title: Dancer2 0.207000 released
item.description: Jason announced the release of Dancer2 with lots of bug fixes, enhancements and documentations. If you use Dancer2 in your work project then you must read this blog to get the complete change history.

item.title: Promoting Perl
item.description: In this blog, Dean, raised very valid and genuine questions how to measure Perl's growth and various ways to promote Perl.

item.title: I'm fully covered
item.description: In this blog, Ben started the discussion how the newly introduced feature of MetaCPAN i.e. Code Coverage has impacted his distributions.

item.title: The Moose did it
item.description: It was the Moose, trust me.

item.title: The point of freedom
item.description: A very interesting article that explains the difference between Free and Open in the field of Software Development.

item.title: Why Good Developers Write Bad Unit Tests
item.description: Practical reasons why good developers write bad unit tests, explained in a plain simple language.

item.title: Learn how to build an Offline-First application in Vue
item.description: Learn the Offline-First approach to Software Development where a lack of network connection is not treated as an error.

item.title: Top programming languages of 2018
item.description: In this GitHub blog by Thomas, gets the insights how different programming languages fared in the year 2018.

item.title: Inaugural Charlotte Perl Mongers meet & greet
item.description: Jason Chrome invites all Perl developer in the Charlotte, NC to the first social event for the Charlotte Perl Mongers.

item.title: London Perl Workshop Schedule
item.description: The schedule for the upcoming annual event London Perl Workshop is out now. If you haven't registered yet then please do register your interest.

item.title: #382 - London Perl Workshop 2018
item.description:
Hi there

The next Saturday, 24th Nov 2018, is the London Perl Workshop action day. For the first time, I have seen the preparations so closely, being part of the oragnisers team, how much effort and hard work involved in the preparations. This year also we have lots of very interesting talks and hands-on training session organised. Thanks to all the speakers and sponsors. But for me, the main attraction is going to be the open session "I am a Former London.PM Leader - Ask Me Anything". If you are attending the workshop then you wouldn't want to miss the opportunity to ask questions directly to the designated guests. It is going to be hosted by none other than, Katherine Spice.

If you are regular visitor of metacpan.org then you would have noticed a new link "% Coverage" on the distribution home page. I think this was done during the recent meta::hack session. I personally like this new addition. It has forced me to address the coverage issue of my personal distributions that I have been avoiding so far. Please do share your views on the same.

Let us talk about Raku Perl 6 'Diwali' 6.d Language Specification release. I have been following this discussion on Twitter prior to the release. I was very excited for a very different reason though. Being, an Indian, I was so happy that the Perl 6 team, picked 'Diwali' as 6.d release name. Diwali is one of my favourite festivals. For those, who don't know, it is a festival of lights. Having said that, I hardly get to celebrate ever since I moved to London. I really miss the fun and celebration.

Enjoy reading this week newsletter
